p: Matrix metalloproteinase (MMP) also plays an important role in the pathogenesis of ALI and ARDS [ 29, 30]. As showed in Fig 5, IAV infection (NC group) could significantly up-regulate the expressions of MMP2, MMP3, MMP9, MMP13, and TIMP-1, comparing with the BC group. Rhein could significantly inhibit the mRNA transcriptions of MMP2, MMP3, MMP9, and MMP13, but not for the transcription of TIMP-1. At the protein level, rhein could significantly inhibit the production of MMP2, MMP3, and MMP9, but not for the production of MMP13 and TIMP-1, comparing with the NC group.
